PROS:
* Lots of replay value due to user-made puzzles - Potentially playing infinite puzzles!
* Story mode is rich in atmosphere, clever in writing and voice acting, and immersive sound design (including music)
* Making your friends hate you through the co-op puzzles is loads of fun!
* Plenty of story-driven mods that can acts as free DLC

CONS:
* Some of the puzzles in the middle of the story act more as "find the white, portal-able spot hidden way out of view" than actual puzzles. Luckily, these moments are few

This is literally my favorite game ever. Not only are the puzzles the best in any game I've ever played, the story is also extrordinary. Love it to pieces.

Portal 2 is one of the very few games that I keep coming back to year after year. I've played through countless times and always find something that I missed or forgot about. And to be reminded of the hilarious banter with Wheatley and GLaDOS is worth the return trip every single time.

Puzzles are challenging - and I find myself forgetting how I completed many so it feels brand new (or sort of deja vu), and I'm still trying for achievements that I missed the first/second/third/fourth time around.

Of every game I have played, my yearning for Portal 3 takes the cake. Although I love open world / RPG and simulation games, there's just something truly special about the universe of Portal.

You think this is a puzzle game? Oh it is so much more! A true adventure, a lot of comedy, and even when you're done, there are still chambers to do with a friend, and even when you're done with those, there are still chambers made by players, and even when you're done with those, you can still make your own chambers!
